name: The Surface of Dashed Hopes
description: With the revelation that the fantasies are being created by the sentient dream machine, many factions seek to make Elpis V their new home. But that decision may fall to the planet's longtime steward. Make the dreams of Elpis V's past a reality.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Rurigan, Rom, M. Burnham, Innovators or Luau Q will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Rurigan, Rom, M. Burnham, Innovators or Luau Q
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Rom
featured_crew.flavor: Quark’s younger brother, who has worked for several years in his bar.

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Rom
rewards.flavor: Younger brother of Quark, Rom found success in Deep Space Nine's Engineering crew.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

adventures.name: Steward's Treaty
adventures.description: Sign an agreement with the dream machine.

adventures.name: Holo Updates
adventures.description: Update the holo emitters for the Elpis V holograms.

adventures.name: No Eavesdropping
adventures.description: Adjust the machine and draft a protocol for accessing minds.

adventures.name: Waking Up
adventures.description: Draft a plan for the future of Elpis V.

rewards.name: The Surface of Dashed Hopes
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Steward's Treaty
adventures.description: Sign an agreement with the dream machine.

adventures.name: Holo Updates
adventures.description: Update the holo emitters for the Elpis V holograms.

adventures.name: Past and Present
adventures.description: Create an accurate record of the planet's history.

adventures.name: Waking Up
adventures.description: Draft a plan for the future of Elpis V.

rewards.name: The Surface of Dashed Hopes
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

action.name: I Am Trying To Save You

rewards.name: Rom
rewards.flavor: Quark’s younger brother, who has worked for several years in his bar.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "A world where any dream could come true. That sounds like...well, uh, a dream come true!"

"If it sounds too good to be true, though, it usually is. And that seems to be the case here. The dreams are merely more convincing holograms, but at the end of the day, the result is still as fleeting."
"Exactly. And without someone actually controlling the holograms or something to restrict them, we could end up with more erratic space flights."
"Not to mention the toxic appeal to anyone who would use this dream machine for malicious ends. But before we can make our next move, we'll need more information."
"A world where any dream could come true. That sounds like...well, uh, a dream come true!"

"If it sounds too good to be true, though, it usually is. And that seems to be the case here. The dreams are merely more convincing holograms, but at the end of the day, the result is still as fleeting."
"Exactly. And without someone actually controlling the holograms or something to restrict them, we could end up with more erratic space flights."
"Not to mention the toxic appeal to anyone who would use this dream machine for malicious ends. But before we can make our next move, we'll need more information."
"Nice work, Captain. It looks like interest in Elpis V has heated up, but you handled the increase in visitors - and in competition for potential new residents - with skill and intelligence."

"I can tell you from dealing with my brother that sometimes dealing with interested parties is the hardest part. I mean, who knows what would happen if someone took over this planet? What would they do with that dream machine anyway?"

"Do I not have a say in all this? I'm sorry, how rude of me for not introducing myself sooner. I had no way of communicating in a way your species is accustomed to until I came across holograms of this divine individual. I'm sure you understand why I borrowed his likeness."

responses.text: "What happened to the civilization who created you?"
"Why did you do all this now?"

screens.text: "At any rate, I feel it is vital I speak in my own defense. I may be a machine crafted by a civilization long extinct, but I have been faithful in fulfilling my duties. Caring for Elpis V, granting the wishes of those who visit, rare though they may be."

"I believe there is some wisdom among lifeforms such as yours than discourages those who would try to live exclusively in dreams. They forgot their own mortality, the needs of their species and their planet. They just faded away like night into day."

"For centuries, perhaps millennia. I once knew, but I deleted that information to make room for other improvements. Visitors did come and each time, I sought to make all their dreams and fantasies come true, in the hopes they would bring others with them and end my loneliness."

"It may sound unthinkable that a machine might forget or age, but I was losing touch with myself, with the purpose for which I was created. I continued improving my technology and the holograms over the years, but had no one to share it with."
"I know you all see me as just a machine, with no rights to own or govern land. But this is my home. And I have cared more for it, for far longer, than any other inhabitant."
"He has a point. And it's an important one to consider. This is a heavy decision, Captain, but let's work hard to find a solution for Elpis V and its longest lived inhabitant."
"Nice work, Captain. It looks like interest in Elpis V has heated up, but you handled the increase in visitors - and in competition for potential new residents - with skill and intelligence."

"I can tell you from dealing with my brother that sometimes dealing with interested parties is the hardest part. I mean, who knows what would happen if someone took over this planet? What would they do with that dream machine anyway?"

"Do I not have a say in all this? I'm sorry, how rude of me for not introducing myself sooner. I had no way of communicating in a way your species is accustomed to until I came across holograms of this divine individual. I'm sure you understand why I borrowed his likeness."

responses.text: "What happened to the civilization who created you?"
"Why did you do all this now?"

screens.text: "At any rate, I feel it is vital I speak in my own defense. I may be a machine crafted by a civilization long extinct, but I have been faithful in fulfilling my duties. Caring for Elpis V, granting the wishes of those who visit, rare though they may be."

"I believe there is some wisdom among lifeforms such as yours than discourages those who would try to live exclusively in dreams. They forgot their own mortality, the needs of their species and their planet. They just faded away like night into day."

"For centuries, perhaps millennia. I once knew, but I deleted that information to make room for other improvements. Visitors did come and each time, I sought to make all their dreams and fantasies come true, in the hopes they would bring others with them and end my loneliness."

"It may sound unthinkable that a machine might forget or age, but I was losing touch with myself, with the purpose for which I was created. I continued improving my technology and the holograms over the years, but had no one to share it with."
"I know you all see me as just a machine, with no rights to own or govern land. But this is my home. And I have cared more for it, for far longer, than any other inhabitant."
"He has a point. And it's an important one to consider. This is a heavy decision, Captain, but let's work hard to find a solution for Elpis V and its longest lived inhabitant."
